intro: Echium pilicaule, commonly known as the slender thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its flowers are blue or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is noted for its distinctive, narrow leaves and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
